metadata.title: CVE-2023-52600 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix uaf in jfs_evict_inode When the execution of diMount(ipimap) fails, theobject ipimap that has been released may be accessed in diFreeSpecial().Asynchronous ipimap release occurs when rcu_core() calls jfs_free_node().Therefore, when diMount(ipimap) fails, sbi->ipimap should not beinitialized as ipimap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-105-generic - 5.15.0-105.115
linux-image-5.15.0-105-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-105.115
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-105-generic - 5.15.0-105.115
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-105-generic-64k - 5.15.0-105.115
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-28-generic - 6.5.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-28-generic - 6.5.0-28.29~22.04.1
